r
Bodley I have receaved yo
r
l
re
, w
ch
I
thancke vearie hartelie fo
r
and since that
annother from the
States,
wherin it appeares
that my sending of
Mattroote
to them hath
satisfyed them, so as that l
re
requireth
no answeare. Co ncerning the contribuc
o
n
assoone as they shall set downe any course
to be taken in it, it shall be
fourmed.
And fo
r
other matters I leave to this bearers
relac
o
n. Who hath seene something of eich
ticular. When I shall receave l
re
s
from the
States
concerning the order fo
r
the contribuc
o
n I will presentlie send a man
of myne owne unto yo
u
, and by him will
wryt more Lardglie. Till then I will
rec
o
mend me hartelie to yo
r
self and c
o
mitt
yo
u
to the tricon of the Allmightie.
From Ostend this xxi Septem
b
1591
Yo
r
most assured Loving freind Edward Norreys
M
r
bodley I had wrytten
a long letter unto you in my defence
against these untrue report
made against me, but
ceyving by
[the]
states letters that they are satisfyed w
th
the reporte of Matruict
[.]
it needles.
Cortykine
was employed to brussels to stay a litell
[.]
have bene printed against her
Majesty:
I pray you therfore
[.]
you can for his deliverye
